definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Remember that history, and your children, will judge you.
sentences.chinese: 记住，你的功过得失，历史和后人自会评判。

sentences.english: This article tries to give a brief discussion on Chen's achievements and mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 本文试对陈独秀的功过是非略陈管见。

sentences.english: Awes the Reese special department weighs the world the right and wrong merit.
sentences.chinese: 奥斯里斯专司衡量人间的是非功过。

sentences.english: The general assessment of his work is 70% achievements and 30% mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 大家认为他的功过是三七开。

sentences.english: On the rights and wrongs of the revolution he would not often let himself be drawn;
sentences.chinese: 关于古巴革命的是非功过，他也不愿评价。

sentences.english: Xu's life has been differently appraised.
sentences.chinese: 对于徐有贞功过的一生，历来评价不一。

sentences.english: The legacy would take care of itself, probably long after I was dead.
sentences.chinese: 我的功过自会有人评价，或许要等到我去世后很久。

sentences.english: Good or bad, everyone seems to have an opinion about Mr.
sentences.chinese: 朱先生的好坏功过，每个人心中都有一杆秤。

definition: don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
to appraise/to pass judgment on/to speak ill of/praise and censure/appraisal
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
to flourish and decay/rise and fall
